name: NYC Jobs
title: NYC Jobs

api_list.name: /residencyRequirement
api_list.description: The 'residencyRequirement' endpoint from the NYCJobs API provides information about the residency requirements for various job positions in New York City. It returns an array of strings that describe the specific residency requirements for each position. This endpoint helps job seekers understand whether New York City residency is necessary for a particular job or if it is not required. The strings in the array may vary, indicating different scenarios such as residency not being required at all for a specific position or not being required initially but becoming mandatory within a certain time frame, typically 90 days from appointment. In some cases, the endpoint may mention exceptions for City Employees who have worked continuously for at least 2 years, allowing them to reside in specific counties outside of New York City. It is important for applicants to consult with the agency representative during the interview process to determine if a specific residency requirement applies to them.

api_list.name: /postUntil
api_list.description: The 'postUntil' endpoint from the NYCJobs API provides a user-friendly way to fetch a list of all the possible values for the 'postUntil' field. This field represents the expiration date or deadline for a job posting on the NYCJobs platform. When you access this endpoint, it returns an array of strings, where each string represents a different possible value for the 'postUntil' field. These values are dates in a specific format, such as '05-OCT-2023'. The 'postUntil' field indicates until when a job posting will remain active and visible on the platform.By using the 'postUntil' endpoint, you can retrieve all the available expiration dates for job postings. This information can be helpful for job seekers to know the deadline for applying to a particular job opening and for employers to keep track of the posting duration.

api_list.name: /hoursShift
api_list.description: The 'hoursShift' endpoint from the NYCJobs API provides information about the various work shift options available for job listings in New York City. This endpoint returns an array of strings containing the possible values for the 'hoursShift' field. The 'hoursShift' field refers to the specific working hours or schedule associated with a particular job listing. It may include details such as start time, end time, work duration per day, and flexibility options. For example, a typical value could be '9:00am-5:00pm (Flexible) 35 Hours per week.'By accessing this endpoint, users can retrieve a range of possible work shifts offered by employers in NYC. This information can be useful for job seekers who have specific scheduling preferences or constraints. It allows them to filter and identify job opportunities that align with their desired working hours or flexibility requirements.Overall, the 'hoursShift' endpoint in the NYCJobs API provides insights into the diverse work schedules available for job seekers in New York City and assists in narrowing down job options based on individual preferences.

api_list.name: /qualificationRequirements
api_list.description: The 'qualificationRequirements' endpoint provided by the NYCJobs API offers a convenient way to access a range of potential qualification requirements for various job listings in New York City. By making a request to this endpoint, users can retrieve an array of strings that represent the possible values for the 'qualificationRequirements' field. These strings provide information about the skills, education, experience, or any other specific requirements that may be necessary for a particular job. This endpoint allows users to gather insights into the types of qualifications employers in New York City are seeking for different positions. It can be valuable for job seekers who are looking to better understand the expectations and criteria set by employers. Additionally, this information can be useful for career counselors, recruiters, or developers creating job search applications to provide accurate and up-to-date qualification information to their users. By making use of this API endpoint, individuals and organizations can gain useful insights into the diverse range of qualification requirements for various job opportunities in NYC.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is the central feature of the 'NYCJobs' API, offering a valuable resource for users seeking specific information regarding job listings in New York City. Upon accessing this endpoint, users can expect to receive a collection of objects that represent individual rows of relevant data aligned with their specified query parameters.This endpoint acts as a gateway to a vast array of job-related information, tailored to cater to the unique requirements of each user. By making use of the 'records' endpoint, users can obtain crucial details such as job titles, descriptions, company names, required qualifications, and other pertinent information about available positions throughout NYC.With the ability to filter and customize their queries, users can fine-tune their search results according to their desired criteria, ensuring that the returned array of objects aligns precisely with their needs. This empowers users to easily explore and discover a diverse range of employment opportunities within the vibrant job market of New York City.The 'records' endpoint serves as a reliable and user-friendly tool, simplifying the job searching process and providing an efficient means to access an extensive database of job listings. Whether one is seeking an entry-level position or a high-level executive role, the 'records' endpoint offers a rich and comprehensive resource to aid in finding their dream job in the bustling city of New York.

api_list.name: /postingDate
api_list.description: The 'postingDate' endpoint from the NYCJobs API provides a convenient way to access a range of possible values for the field 'postingDate'. This field represents the date when a job posting was made available on the NYCJobs platform. The endpoint allows users to obtain an array of strings, each string being a specific posting date. By querying this endpoint, users can retrieve a list of all the different posting dates available in the API. This information can be useful in analyzing trends or patterns in job postings over time. For example, users can identify the busiest or most active days for job postings, or track the frequency of postings during certain periods.The 'postingDate' values returned by this endpoint are in the format of MM/DD/YYYY, indicating the month, day, and year of the posting. With the array of strings obtained from this endpoint, users can further process or analyze the data according to their specific needs.

api_list.name: /postingUpdated
api_list.description: The 'postingUpdated' endpoint of the 'NYCJobs' API provides a user-friendly way to access all the possible values for the 'postingUpdated' field. This field represents the date and time when a job posting on the platform was last updated. The endpoint returns an array of strings that represent different 'postingUpdated' values. Each value in the array corresponds to a specific date and time when the job posting was updated.By using this endpoint, users can conveniently retrieve a list of updated job postings and stay updated with the most recent changes. The 'postingUpdated' values can be useful for job seekers who want to find the latest job postings or for employers who need to track the currency of their job listings. The array of 'postingUpdated' values can be easily integrated into applications or web services to enhance job search functionalities and provide users with real-time updates on job listings.

api_list.name: /workLocation1
api_list.description: The 'workLocation1' endpoint of the NYCJobs API provides an array of strings that represent the potential work locations for various job listings. These work locations indicate the physical addresses or locations where specific jobs are located within New York City. By leveraging this endpoint, users can access a comprehensive list of all possible work locations provided by the API.Each string value within the array represents a unique work location, which can include details such as building names, street addresses, floor numbers, and zip codes. Users can expect a range of work locations to be returned, encompassing different areas and neighborhoods within New York City.This endpoint is particularly useful for job seekers as it allows them to explore and filter job opportunities based on their preferred work locations. It provides a convenient way to identify potential jobs based on specific areas of interest or accessibility, helping job seekers find opportunities that align with their preferences and commuting requirements.

api_list.name: /salary
api_list.description: The 'salary' endpoint from the NYCJobs API provides a range of possible values for the field 'salary'. It returns an array of strings representing different salary ranges available for the job listings in New York City. This information can be beneficial for job seekers as it helps them understand the potential earning opportunities for various positions. By accessing this endpoint, users can gather insights into the salary levels prevalent in the job market, enabling them to make informed decisions about their career choices. The array of strings might include salary ranges like 'Under $30,000', '$30,000 - $40,000', '$40,000 - $50,000', and so on. This user-friendly API endpoint empowers individuals to explore the salary landscape of NYC and consider their desired earning potential while searching for suitable job opportunities.

api_list.name: /preferredSkills
api_list.description: The 'preferredSkills' endpoint in the NYCJobs API provides valuable information about the preferred skills and knowledge that employers in New York City are looking for in their job candidates. When you access this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings that represent a wide range of skills that employers desire. These skills can be technical expertise, such as knowledge of specific software systems like FMS, APT, HHS Accelerator, or PASSPort, which are commonly used by the City. It may also include familiarity with the City's Procurement Rules, which govern the purchasing process for goods and services. Additionally, having experience in interacting with vendors and City officials might be considered advantageous. Each string in the array represents a desirable skill that employers want their potential employees to possess. This endpoint is particularly useful for job seekers as it allows them to understand and focus on the preferred skills mentioned by employers, thereby enhancing their chances of securing relevant job opportunities in New York City.
